intro: Helictotrichon tentoense, commonly known as the Tentoense needlegrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. This perennial grass is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, with a bluish-green hue. The plant is adapted to harsh environments, exhibiting drought tolerance and the ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
